rename.from: Catch is susceptible to VC12 bug: Catch is susceptible to VC12 bug: do-while loop within range-based-for fails to compile.
rename.to: Catch is susceptible to VC12 bug: do-while loop within range-based-for fails to compile.

body: honestly, I don't spot the difference between the two versions...
@Kosta-Github The workaround version has braces around the do-while. They (should!) be semantically identical
ah, I see, hard to spot due to the same level of indention... :-)

@Kosta-Github How w'd you suggest to format both fragments ? ;)

Improved original message (hopefully).
Thanks for this, Martin. An entry for the FAQ, I think (which I'll be putting together shortly!)
@philsquared why not adding the additional `{` and `}` to the `REQUIRE` macro inside of `CATCH`? I guess that is what @martinmoene also suggests, right?
because that would defeat the purpose of the do...while idiom in the first place (to require the `;`, without generating warnings about redundant `;`s - while being usable in block statements.
@philsquared Another good reason not to deform CATCH ;)
Not sure what deformation you're referring to?
Bending code to bypass a bug leading to unwanted or less clear code...

mmm, 
- will not fix, and
- useful information for some users of Catch

When closing the issue, the information moves out of sight; what to do?
I am going to add this into documentation, instead of keeping the issue open.
